data.title: Muhammad Ali (Cassius Marcellus Clay, Jr.) - San Francisco Public Library
data.meta_description: Muhammad Ali (Cassius Marcellus Clay, Jr.) by SFPL_AfrAmCenter - a staff-created list : Born Cassius Marcellus Clay, Jr., Muhammad Ali (January 17, 1942 – June 3, 2016) was an American professional boxer who was considered one of the greatest and most significant sporting figures in history. Clay began training when he was 12 years old and at the age of 22, he won the world heavyweight championship against Sonny Liston (1964). After Clay converted to Islam, he changed his "slave" name to Ali, signifying racial pride for African Americans and resistance to white domination.
data.text:
To honor Muhammad Ali, Taschen has created a work that is epic in scale and as unique and vibrant as Ali himself. GOAT - Greatest of All Time provides a worthy tribute to Muhammad Ali that reflects the scale of his achievements. To honor Muhammad Ali, Taschen has created a work that is epic in scale and as unique and vibrant as Ali himself. GOAT - Greatest of All Time provides a worthy tribute to Muhammad Ali that reflects the scale of his achievements. Show less

In-library use only in some locations

The Trials of Muhammad Ali offers a look at legendary boxer Muhammad Ali's attempt to overturn a five-year prison sentence for refusing to serve in the US military during the Vietnam War. The Trials of Muhammad Ali offers a look at legendary boxer Muhammad Ali's attempt to overturn a five-year prison sentence for refusing to serve in the US military during the Vietnam War. Show less

Ishmael Reed's The Complete Muhammad Ali includes material and photographs not included in most other publications. The Complete Muhammad Ali charts Ali's...Show more Ishmael Reed's The Complete Muhammad Ali includes material and photographs not included in most other publications. The Complete Muhammad Ali charts Ali's evolution from Black Nationalism to a universalism, but does not discount the Nation of Islam and Black Nationalism's influence on his intellectual development. Fans of Muhammad Ali, boxing fans, and those interested in modern African American history and the Nation of Islam will be fascinated by this biography by an accomplished American author. Show less

I Am Ali provides an intimate and heart-warming look at Mohammad Ali. The documentary is told through exclusive, unprecedented access to Ali's personal ar...Show more I Am Ali provides an intimate and heart-warming look at Mohammad Ali. The documentary is told through exclusive, unprecedented access to Ali's personal archive of voice recordings with interviews and testimonials from his inner circle of family and friends - including his daughters, son, ex-wife, brother, and legends of the boxing community: Mike Tyson, George Foreman, and Gene Kilroy. Show less

The Man of Tomorrow and the Champ are two of the mightiest warriors the Earth has ever known. Now they must face their greatest challenge yet… each other! The Man of Tomorrow and the Champ are two of the mightiest warriors the Earth has ever known. Now they must face their greatest challenge yet… each other! Show less

In Redemption Song, Marqusee examines Muhammad Ali in his true historical context, exploring a crucial moment at the crossroads of popular culture and mas...Show more In Redemption Song, Marqusee examines Muhammad Ali in his true historical context, exploring a crucial moment at the crossroads of popular culture and mass resistance. In the new afterword for this second edition, Marqusee reflects on Ali's legacy in the era of the 'War on Terror.' Show less

King of the World includes pivotal figures and events that affected the life of Muhammad Ali. King of the World includes pivotal figures and events that affected the life of Muhammad Ali. Show less

Ten boxers reveal what it was like to fight against Muhammad Ali, the man many consider to be the best boxer ever. Join these respected fighters as they weigh in on 'The Greatest' and pay tribute to a legend. Ten boxers reveal what it was like to fight against Muhammad Ali, the man many consider to be the best boxer ever. Join these respected fighters as they weigh in on 'The Greatest' and pay tribute to a legend. Show less

'Smokin' Joe Frazier and Muhammad Ali fought three times, but it would be their epic third encounter in 1975 that cemented their rivalry. Now Frazier offe...Show more 'Smokin' Joe Frazier and Muhammad Ali fought three times, but it would be their epic third encounter in 1975 that cemented their rivalry. Now Frazier offers up his account of the events leading up to the legendary 'thrilla in Manila' and how a one-time friend turned into his greatest foe. Show less

In 1962, boxing writers and fans considered Cassius Clay an obnoxious self-promoter, and few believed that he would become the heavyweight champion of the...Show more In 1962, boxing writers and fans considered Cassius Clay an obnoxious self-promoter, and few believed that he would become the heavyweight champion of the world. But Malcolm X, the most famous minister in the Nation of Islam, saw the potential in Clay, not just for boxing greatness, but as a means of spreading the Nation's message. The two became fast friends, keeping their interactions secret from the press for fear of jeopardizing Clay's career. Clay began living a double life - a patriotic "good Negro" in public, and a radical reformer behind the scenes. Soon, however, Malcolm X and Clay's friendship would sour, with disastrous and far-reaching consequences. Show less

A documentary on Mohammad Ali at the time of the famous 1974 "Rumble in the Jungle" match with George Foreman in Zaire. Includes a music festival featuring America's top African American performers, James Brown and B.B. King. A documentary on Mohammad Ali at the time of the famous 1974 "Rumble in the Jungle" match with George Foreman in Zaire. Includes a music festival featuring America's top African American performers, James Brown and B.B. King. Show less

A former medical sales manager traces his longtime friendship with Muhammad Ali, providing accounts of how they bonded over shared efforts helping underpr...Show more A former medical sales manager traces his longtime friendship with Muhammad Ali, providing accounts of how they bonded over shared efforts helping underprivileged kids. Shanahan also describes Ali's countless acts of unpublicized generosity over the years. Show less

From Muhammad Ali's appearance as an Olympic champion to his iconic status as a national hero, his carefully-constructed image and controversial persona h...Show more From Muhammad Ali's appearance as an Olympic champion to his iconic status as a national hero, his carefully-constructed image and controversial persona have always been intensely scrutinized. In Muhammad Ali: The Making of an Icon, Ezra examines the relationships between Ali's cultural appeal and its commercial manifestations by citing examples of the boxer's relationship to the Vietnam War and the Nation of Islam. Show less

All copies in use Availability details

The Soul of a Butterfly presents the spiritual memoirs of former heavyweight boxing champion, Muhammad Ali, and chronicles his life and faith in the years since his retirement from boxing. The Soul of a Butterfly presents the spiritual memoirs of former heavyweight boxing champion, Muhammad Ali, and chronicles his life and faith in the years since his retirement from boxing. Show less

This is a reissue of Champions Forever, a documentary that explores the careers of five heavyweight boxing champions, with never-before-seen interviews fi...Show more This is a reissue of Champions Forever, a documentary that explores the careers of five heavyweight boxing champions, with never-before-seen interviews filmed at the time the documentary was made. Champions Forever also includes footage from a dinner held in conjunction with the documentary's premiere. Show less

Thirty years after he burst onto the scene as a gold medal light-heavyweight at the Rome Olympics, Muhammad Ali remains a magical figure. His accomplishme...Show more Thirty years after he burst onto the scene as a gold medal light-heavyweight at the Rome Olympics, Muhammad Ali remains a magical figure. His accomplishments include the two fights with Sonny Liston, the three epic wars against Joe Frazier, the stunning victory over George Foreman in Zaire, and the shocking loss and final win that made him the first man to win back the heavyweight crown twice, 14 years after he had first claimed it. With unprecedented candor, bestselling author Thomas Hauser recreates this extraordinary man to reveal Muhammad Ali as deeply religious, mercurial, generous, and a true showman. Show less

All copies in use Availability details
